caption:
This photograph captures a construction or industrial scene featuring a large, yellow, wheel loader. The loader, marked with the label "Allis-Chalmers," appears to be on the verge of slipping off or attempting to navigate a steep earthen slope. The slope is textured with apparent treads or tracks, indicative of prior activity by this or other similar vehicles.

The background of the image shows a waterfront setting, suggesting the loader might be operating near a beach or riverbank, with bare trees and gray skies indicative of a winter or early spring season. The general scene implies a land-moving or excavation operation, possibly related to erosion control, as the vehicle is at the edge where the land meets the water.

Overall, the photograph has a stark, somewhat bleak quality, emphasized by the overcast sky and the barren trees, reflecting a utilitarian focus on the machinery and its interaction with the landscape.
title: Army earthmover piles loose dirt to reinforce lake-eroded lake shore drive
